content.rendered:
Photo by Life of Pix

Hey party people,

After last week’s big update, this week is a little quieter for This Week in Genesis #17 because a lot of the amazing folks in the Genesis community are over at Circles Conference (see below).

Ladies of #genesiswp at #Circles2015 @lindseyriel @shaybocks @emwhitedesigns @laurenmancke @ebizelephant pic.twitter.com/am6WmXWgxE

— Susan Ramsey (@GraphDesigning) September 11, 2015

Side walk pizza with the #genesiswp crew. @restore316 @shaybocks @lindseyriel @grapfdesigning pic.twitter.com/JSd1loaJtI

— Sean Jackson (@seanthinks) September 10, 2015

However I still have a few bits and pieces for you, including the Genesis 2.2.2 update, some exciting new themes and a new Genesis course on Lynda.com.

Let’s get to it.

Genesis 2.2.2 released

Last week saw the release of Genesis 2.2 and just a few days later the team quickly followed up with the release of Genesis 2.2.2 to squash a few minor bugs.

So, #GenesisWP 2.2.1 is live, ya'll. Update via dashboard. Here's the changelog. http://t.co/unDEg6M5FT

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) September 8, 2015

There was a problem with the #GenesisWP 2.2.1 zip file, so I've gone ahead and released 2.2.2 to fix the issue. Look for 2.2.2 in your dash.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) September 9, 2015

If you’re running Genesis on your WordPress website expect to get an update notification next time you find yourself in the admin screens. (I’ve already gone and updated this site without any issue).

Plus, while on the subject of Genesis itself, Rian Rietveld (who did a great job with the accessibility on Genesis 2.2) is also getting props from WordPress lead developer Helen Hou-Sandí for her work on accessibility with WordPress itself.

The work @RianRietveld is doing with testers and the WordPress accessibility team is nothing short of incredible. https://t.co/1DR8sr4fqU

— Helen 侯-Sandí (@helenhousandi) September 8, 2015

Clearly a lady to keep an eye on 🙂

Themes

First up in themes this week, not one but two new Genesis themes – Ivy & Evie and Mary Jane – from Cristina Silvia.

2 new #wordpress themes in our shop: http://t.co/oDyOQgusFx #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/NB8IJC86Az

— Cristina Silvia (@ElanBlogStudio) September 6, 2015

But that’s not all. Shivanand Sharma has also released new Genesis theme Femme Flora.

Just launched our new #genesiswp theme – Femme Flora http://t.co/Qx8cfzudXu. Feminine themes don't get any better 🙂 #wordpress #pink

— Shivanand Sharma (@ShivanandWP) September 8, 2015

Plus, it wouldn’t be a theme update without a theme tease. This week it’s Journey, a nice looking blog theme, coming soon from WP Studio.

A first peek off our upcoming Genesis theme: https://t.co/Tx6e0bdhaf #genesiswp #wordpress

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) September 7, 2015

Showcase

First up in the showcase this week is a great site by Erin Ulrich for cherigregory.com

Congrats to @CheriGregory on her new #genesiswp site! http://t.co/geSYRfGbtO

— Erin Ulrich (@erinulrich) September 8, 2015

…Quincy Zikmund rocking out a new site for haaa.org

My latest #genesiswp project just launched for Henderson Area Arts Alliance. http://t.co/mH2fQcHjk7

— Quincy Zikmund (@quincyzikmund) September 8, 2015

…and Neil Gee does a great customisation of Restored 316’s Flourish theme for synthesisorganics.com

Launched http://t.co/TopE8WdH18 based off Flourish theme by @restored316 #genesiswp

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) September 11, 2015

Podcasts

A change in hosts this week for the UK Genesis podcast sees Jo Waltham and for the first time as host, Paul Smart, take the hotseat as they talk to Julia Sydnor.

#UKGenesis + brace face. Geeking out about #GenesisWP and autoresponders > https://t.co/RRqSHR3BGV

— Julia Sydnor (@PixelFrau) September 9, 2015

Courses

A mini courses update this week, first up is the news that one of the Genesis community’s finest, Carrie Dils has launched a new Build a Restaurant Website with Genesis course over at Lynda.com where she already has several other Genesis courses.

My latest @lynda course is now available! Build a Restaurant Website with #genesiswp http://t.co/FSos8qiaIS

— carrie dils (@cdils) September 10, 2015

Plus, if you’d a Treehouse member and would like to see a PSD to Genesis course over there you can give your feedback on this forum thread.

If you want to see a PSD to #GenesisWP course happen at @treehouse, this is the link to chime in at: http://t.co/78a3stlGMG

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) September 9, 2015

And finally…

Nothing to do with Genesis but if you’re experiencing a weird menu bug in WordPress since updating to 4.3 (when using Google Chrome), you’re not alone and there is a fix.

If you’re a developer and don’t want the hassle of having to ask all your clients to do that there’s a plugin that you can install which will solve the problem (h/t Mounir)

—

That’s all for this week, have a fantastic weekend.

PS Like these updates? Subscribe!

excerpt.rendered: Genesis 2.2.2 released, new themes, and a new course from Carrie Dils, it’s This Week in Genesis #16.
